title: As a BOC User, I want to edit a Domestic Amateur Player Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC ( test_boc_approver@mlb.com	/   solace27neutron )

Wire:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=info

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery++-+Amateur+Profile+-+Info+Tab
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing a Domestic Amateur Players profile
custom_expected:
THEN

 - BOC Users with the correct permissions will see a grey Edit button when viewing a Dom Ama Player Profile
 - Clicking  Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save (grey) button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode).
 - Editable fields will match what is in the provided Data Discovery (Note the special behaviors)

title: As a BOC User, I want to View the Top 300 widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Top+300+Widget

Wire:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=top_300
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 on left hand side / Admin
custom_expected:
THEN


 - On the Admin tab there will be a Top 300 widget, as depicted in the attached wire
 - The widget will match the provided data discovery and wire frame
 - The player's name will be clickable and link to the player's profile
 - Widget will be populated with any player who has the Top 300 flag checked for the indicated draft year
 - This flag will come from DPL

title: As a BOC User, I want to Edit a school
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC

Wire:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=school_profile

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+School+Profile
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Schools 
AND clicks on a school name
AND clicks Edit button
custom_expected:
THEN

EDIT
* An Edit(grey) button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state. 
* Clicking  Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save(grey) button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode).
* Editable fields will match what is in the provided Data Discovery (Note the special behaviors)

SAVE
* A Save button will be available anytime an approved form is in edit mode. You can not save a new school as preliminary.
* Clicking Save will save the school and it's current values and reload the school in view mode. 
* Required field and format checks will only be run.
* The school status will not change from editing alone.  
* After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification. See Messages #77.
* Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey.


CANCEL
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made. 
* If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the school profile. 
* If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in View mode, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
* If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

title: As a BOC User, I want to view the Submitted Schools widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC

Wire:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=submitted_schools

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Submitted+Schools+Widget
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Admin
custom_expected:
THEN

AC:
 - On the Admin tab under Rule 4, there will be a Submitted Schools widget
 - The widget will match the provided wire and data discovery
 - The widget will display all school in a submitted state
 - Clicking the school name will open the submitted school's profile in edit mode
 - When a new school is submitted, it will appear in this widget
 - When a school is approved, it will no longer appear in the widget
 - This widget should have its own permission group

title: As a BOC User, I want to update a Player's R4 Status from the Domestic Amateur Players widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC

Wire:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=domestic_amateur_players

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+BOC+Domestic+Amateur+Widget
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Admin
custom_expected:
THEN


 - There will be an "Update Status" dropdown in the footer of the Domestic Amateur Widget, as depicted in the provided wire
 - The values in the drop down will be as follows:
  - Eligible
  - Not Eligible
  - Not Subject
  - Pending Eligible
  - Removed
  - Drafted
  - Passed Over
 - The dropdown will not become active unless at least one players checkbox is selected
 - Selecting a value from the dropdown will update the R4 Status for the all selected players to the selected status
 - The widget will refresh and a blue success message will be displayed

title: As a BOC User, I want to filter the Domestic Amateur Player widget on Match %
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+BOC+Domestic+Amateur+Widget

Wire:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=domestic_amateur_players
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 / Admin
AND user clicks the filter icon
AND user selects the drop down arrow on middle box
custom_expected:
THEN

 - There will be a new filter type for Match % on the Domestic Amateur player widget
 - There users will be able to add the filter and search for player matches that are >, <, >=, <=, = to a specified percentage

title: As a BOC User, I want to change eligible year on player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC

Wireframe:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=scouting___draft
custom_steps: WHEN on a Domestic Players profile and click Edit button
custom_expected:
THEN


 - BOC User should be able to change a domestic amateur player's eligible year from the player profile
 - If the year is moved forward, gap years should be created in the player's Rule 4 Draft History widget in their profile
 - If the year is moved backwards, any gap years that exist should be removed from the Rule 4 Draft History widget in their profile

title: As a User, I want to Create a New Passed Over Player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged into an account with DAPM Permissions (ex Clubs: ARI or DET) or BOC

Wire:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=amateur_player
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=review_match

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery++-+Amateur+Profile+-+Info+Tab

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Amateur+Profile+-+Header

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Duplicate+Player+Checks
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks Next button when creating a new passed over player (Domestic Amateur)
custom_expected:
THEN

 - There will be a next button on the Create New Player widget (disabled until all required fields are filled in)
 - When the user clicks next, a required field check will be run
 - When the required field check passes, the system will perform a duplicate player check
 - This check will leverage the existing matching logic
 - If matches are found, the user will be prompted with a review match message
  -- Clicking a matching player's name will take the user to that player's profile
  -- Clicking Cancel will return the user to the Create New Player widget
  -- Clicking Ignore & Continue will take the user to a new profile and allow them to proceed with the workflow

custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged into an account with DAPM Permissions (ex Clubs: ARI or DET)

Value:
 -  This will be a new version of the existing Domestic Amateur Quick Search and will not impact the version currently in production

Quick Search Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Quick+Search+Population+rules
custom_steps: WHEN user does a Quick search for a Domestic Amateur Player
custom_expected:
THEN

 - Quick Search should work as described in the provided rules document
 - Clicking on a players name, or hitting enter while the player is highlighted, will take you to the player's profile

title: As a User, I want to view a Domestic Amateur player profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged into an account with DAPM Permissions (ex Clubs: ARI or DET)

Wireframe:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=info

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery++-+Amateur+Profile+-+Info+Tab

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Amateur+Profile+-+Header
custom_steps: WHEN user searches for and views a Domestic Amateur Players profile
custom_expected:
THEN

AC:
 - Clicking on a player's name in a search will open the player's profile
 - Browser tab text should say "Profile - [Last Name], [Roster First]"
-  The form header should read "Info" because that's the default tab loaded.
 - The profile will match the provided data discovery and wire
 - This story only covers the profile page and the profile header
 - The Top 300 flag is only visible to BOC / MLSB users

title: As a User, I want to save a new passed over player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged into an account with DAPM Permissions (ex Clubs: ARI or DET)

Wire:
https://z3s0a8.axshare.com/#p=amateur_player

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery++-+Amateur+Profile+-+Info+Tab

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Amateur+Profile+-+Header
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to Rule 4 on left nav / New Player
AND inputs data for a new DAPM player 
AND clicks Next
custom_expected:
THEN

 - There will be a Save button on the new player profile
 - Clicking Save will run required field checks on the profile
 - Once the checks pass, the system will will create a Passed Over Rule 4 record for the previous draft year (A blue success notification will be thrown)
  -- This will be visible on the players R4 History widget
 - The player's R4 Status will be set to Passed Over
 - The player will be visible to all 30 Clubs and the BOC
